isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING PUMP: VICKERS (LUK) V10NF AND V20NF - DISASSEMBLE

svcsubsecinfo.para: During disassembly, pay close attention to identifying the parts especially the cartridge, to correctly reassemble the components.

note.para: Pump bearings are pressed in the body or on the shaft and should not be removed unless worn or broken.

svcproc.title: BASIC PUMP
svcproc.para: If a mounting bracket is used, remove before dismantling the pump.
Refer to Figure 8 for all Items in parentheses.

note.para: The next step involves removing the cover (Item 2). Mark the position of the cover, the ring (Item 16) and the body (Item 7) so that it will be reassembled correctly. (Also refer to Item 12, Figure 9.)
Port Position - The pump cover can be assembled in 4 positions with respect to the body. A letter in PUMP IDENTIFICATION identifies the cover position as shown in Figure 11.

step1.para: Clamp the pump body in a vise (not too tightly), with the cover end up.
Remove the four cover bolts (Item 1, Figure 8).
After making sure the cover location is marked, remove the cover (Item 2) and O-ring (Item 3).
Remove the pressure plate (Item 4) and spring (Item 18). Note the position of the ring for correct reassembly.
Lift off the cam ring (Item 16) and remove the locating pins (Item 6).
Separate the vanes (Item 5) from the rotor (Item 17) and remove the rotor from the shaft (Item 12).
Turn the pump body (Item 7) over. Remove the shaft key (Item 10) and the snap ring (Item 9) which retains the bearing (Item 13).
Tap with a soft hammer on the splined end of the shaft (Item 12) to force the shaft out of the body (Item 7).
Remove the small snap ring (Item 9), located on the shaft (Item 12), behind the bearing (Item 13).
Support the bearing (Item 13) inner race and press the shaft (Item 12) out of the bearing only if bearing is defective.
Pull the shaft seal (Item 8) out of the body (Item 7) with a suitable hooked tool.
